text: Murrayfield Stadium in Edinburgh is the home of the Scottish national rugby team. It was first built in 1925. In 1995, the stadium was renovated. It has seats for 67,144 people. It held the record for the most people at a rugby union match. 104,000 people watched Scotland play Wales in 1975. Category:Buildings and structures in Edinburgh Category:Sports buildings in the United Kingdom Category:Rugby Category:1925 establishments in Europe Category:1920s establishments in Scotland
title: Murrayfield Stadium
